thread.title: LIVE SCORING: 2025 Monroe Invitational at Monroe Golf Club
thread.title_full: LIVE SCORING: 2025 Monroe Invitational at Monroe Golf Club

author: amateurgolf.com
title: LIVE SCORING: 2025 Monroe Invitational at Monroe Golf Club
text:
Ty Kaufman of Ave Maria University jumped out to the solo lead after Round 1 with a scorching 5-under 65 at Monroe Golf Club. The junior from Naples, Florida and First Team All-Sun Conference selection is quickly making a name for himself in elite amateur circles. Known for his scoring consistencyâ€”he posted seven rounds of par or better last season and owns two career collegiate winsâ€”Kaufman wasted no time attacking the course.
He opened with five birdies in his first 10 holes and kept his composure on the inward nine to hold a one-shot advantage over a stacked leaderboard. A finance major who helped guide Ave Maria to the 2025 NAIA National Championships, Kaufman continues to build on what is shaping up to be a breakout collegiate career. His precision ball-striking and calm demeanor under pressure were both on display in Wednesdayâ€™s opener.
ðŸ“ View Full Leaderboard
The Monroe Invitational returns to Monroe Golf Club in Pittsford, New York from July 23â€“26, 2025, showcasing one of the strongest amateur fields of the summer. Renowned for its rich history and demanding format, the tournament features 72 holes of stroke play with a 54-hole cut after three rounds. With a collection of elite college and mid-amateur talent competing on a classic Donald Ross design, drama is all but guaranteed.
Founded in 1937, the Monroe Invitational has seen many future stars walk its fairways. Tiger Woods reached the semifinals here in 1993. Recent winners include Dustin Johnson (2007), Thomas Pieters (2012), and Andy Ogletree (2019)â€”each of whom went on to success at the professional level.
LIVE SCORING & RESULTS
Monroe plays to a championship layout of 6,971 yards (Par 70), with long, demanding par 4s and slick, multi-tiered greens. The winning score typically lands between 6 and 10 under, but conditions may push that lower or higher. This yearâ€™s forecast includes calm breezes and firm turfâ€”ideal for low scoring early in the week, but likely to reward precision as the course tightens heading into the weekend.
Defending champion Cooper Smith won in thrilling fashion in 2024, emerging from a four-man playoff after finishing at 7-under. He returns to Rochester looking to defend his title against a loaded field that includes fellow 2024 contenders Carter Loflin, Drew Doyle, and Kyle Downey. With a wave of rising collegiate talent joining them, expect a fierce battle for the Monroe crown.
